description.p: A summary of notable changes to the Mac App since December, 2019.

item.title: Using Notenik with Existing Text Files

description.p: Since Notenik is rather late to the game of managing text files, and since those already using similar sorts of files are probably among those interested in my app, I wanted to talk a bit about how the latest version of Notenik can be used with existing folders full of text files.

item.title: The Thinking Behind the Notenik File Format

description.p: People have been storing notes in text files long before Notenik came along. So why is the Notenik format different?

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Versions 2.5.0 and 2.6.0 Released

description.p: Version 2.6.0 was focused on strengthening support for opening folders full of existing text files and handling them smoothly as Notenik Collections.

item.title: Notenik Project # 3: Create a To Do List

description.p: This post is the third in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use this Mac app to create a To Do list.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.4.0 Released

description.p: Most of the changes for this release were focused on providing the capability for wiki-like inter-note linking.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.3.0 Released

description.p: Fixed treatment of the Teaser field, to treat it as a long text field; increased tolerance for Notes with alternative formatting; added Ink as an alternate for parsing of Markdown; added an optional Timestamp field, as a first step to enabling use of Notenik to create a Zettelkasten.

item.title: Notenik for the Mac Version 2.2.0 Released

description.p: Added Cut, Copy and Paste support for Notes; added support for British spelling of 'Favorites'; relocated Reload Collection command to the Collection menu to make it easier to find; suppressed empty tags from the Favorites to HTML export.

item.title: Notenik Project # 2: Create a Collection of Bookmarks

description.p: This post is the second in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use this Mac app to create a Collection of Bookmarks that you can access from any of your web browsers.

item.title: Notenik Project # 1: Create a Simple Collection of Notes

description.p: This post is the first in a series designed to gradually explain the use of Notenik for increasingly complex and sophisticated tasks. Today we're going to use Notenik just to create a basic Collection of Notes about anything that might interest you.
